Question: I am willing and able to make lifestyle adjustments when needed
I know what my intrinsic skills are and use them regularly
I have thought through and am comfortable with my medium and long-term living arrangements that take into account my physical, mental and social well-being
I practice gratitude in my habits and rhythms
I have plans to keep using many of my intrinsic skills during my retirement years
I have a curious mind
I like to be challenged and stretched to grow in my knowledge in both the depth and breadth of subject interests
I exercise properly at least 3 times a week
I have emotional capacity to cope with change
I enjoy brain games and like to challenge myself mentally
I see my retirement as the first phase of a transition process rather than as the final curtain
I have a good concentration span and seldom run out of mental or emotional energy
I have clear values and am committed to live true to them
Before I embark on something new, I process what I need to leave behind or say goodbye to
I am excited about the advantages that retirement brings
I reflect properly about the changes that I have gone through in life
I am good at finding creative outlets for my skills and competencies
I love to master and refine the crafts involved in my hobbies and passions
I read regularly
I am open to picking up an old hobby, sport or interest again that I used to enjoy many years ago
I have come through life's transitions without bitterness, regrets, scars or emotional wounds
I have plans and ideas of meaningful things I would like to spend time doing with the special people in my life
If it was up to me, I know what I would like to be written on my epitaph
I know and communicate my own love languages as well as those closest to me
I have little anxiety about my financial preparedness for my retirement years
I am not worried about my genetic history regarding mental health and well-being
I have a "happy list" of the simple yet beautiful things that bring me joy and contentment on a regular basis
My life's journey has been relatively free of fear and anxiety
I keep "sharpening the axe" to grow in my skills and competencies
I know what my interests are and like to stay in touch with current developments in these areas
I have plans to maintain my physical, mental and social well-being during retirement
I have a "bucket list" of things I would like to do before I die
Thinking of the biggest changes and transitions in my life, I have been able to extract the positives and release yet learn from the negatives
I am easily motivated to put my skills into practice and I know what environments motivate me the most
I do not have unfinished business as I think about the future and/or leaving this world
I manage stress well and have been able to cope with or avoid burnout and/or depression through my life so far
I look forward to being at home more and so is my family looking forward to having me home more and/or more available
My sleep patterns are healthy and not easily disturbed
I am not afraid of retirement or ageing
I believe that growing in mastery is a lifelong pursuit
I can improvise and adapt to ensure I get sufficient movement and physical exercise within the limitations of my age and capacity
I am not afraid to try something new
I rest and enjoy silence, solitude and sabbath on a regular basis
I am able to spend my time on meaningful pursuits and adapt these pursuits within the means available to me
I lead an active life and prefer doing to watching
I prefer doing things with others rather than by myself
My will, legal and financial arrangements are up to date
I am at peace with myself and the world
I am content with the quality and quantity of my relationships with both family and friends
I am content with my current state of health
I am happy to live a long, healthy and meaningful life
I have a healthy diet and avoid excesses
I tend to grow through change
I look forward to growing old and still making a meaningful contribution to others
I am good at letting go of unnecessary baggage
I am stimulated by interesting conversations and contribute in a healthy way
I look forward to continuing to see and spend time with some of my work colleagues after retirement
I consider the impact of changes in my life on others too
I enjoy the privilege of doing what I am good at and love to do
I know what I am passionate about in both my professional and personal life
I have little to no regrets with how my relationships have been affected by my career
I am active in several hobbies that bring me joy
I have a healthy attitude to work
I have a healthy self-awareness and can easily say yes to myself
I have a healthy appreciation for people and show it naturally and regularly
I am willing and able to share my experience and expertise with previous employers, colleagues or clients whether for remuneration or not
I regularly get excited about doing new things that I have planned or do as part of my normal routines & rhythms
I am happy to think and talk about the end of season that retirement brings
I have some clear 5 year, 10 year and longer term goals
I am able to cope well with the physical, psychological, emotional and relational changes that come with retirement
I think a lot about my legacy and what I would like to pass on to others
I am a good mentor and willing to give of myself unselfishly to others
I was / will be able to close out my pre-retirement working season with dignity and meaning
I will not get bored easily during retirement
I respect limits
I know that one season needs to end for a new season to begin
I am not afraid of dying
